intro: Sauropus varieri, commonly known as the variable hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Sauropus varieri is relatively low-maintenance and can be grown in both indoor and outdoor settings.
